intro: Ballota antilibanotica, commonly known as the Libanotis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties. The plant features small, delicate white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, rounded leaflets. Ballota antilibanotica is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
